info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 12:00PM EST until January 14 at 12:30PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Essex County in northern New York... * Until 1230 PM EST. * At 1200 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Elizabethtown to 7 miles southwest of Minerva, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes Interstate 87 between mile markers 82 and 120. Locations impacted include... Elizabethtown, Minerva, Schroon Lake, North Hudson, Paradox, Olmstedville, Witherbee, South Schroon, Underwood, Schroon Falls, Steep Bay, Whallonsburg, Grass Island, Wadhams, Severance, and New Russia. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
